learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate an understanding of and an ability to critically apply occupational hygiene principles to the anticipation, recognition, evaluation, communication and control of workplace health hazards.
Review and apply key toxicology principles, exposure standards and basic statistics to the evaluation of complex occupational health and hygiene risks.
Demonstrate an understanding of and an ability to apply the principles of the hierarchy of control to the selection of control measures for a range of complex occupational health hazards.
Select appropriate equipment to measure specific airborne contaminants and devise suitable sampling strategies.
Plan, conduct and prepare a scientific report on a complex survey of a workplace atmospheric contaminant in a manner useful for health risk assessment purposes.
Apply occupational hygiene principles to the completion of hazardous chemical risk assessments.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be presented with a number of typical occupational hygiene issues and asked to prepare a response based on the scenario provided. The problem will require students to further develop and apply their knowledge and understanding of hazardous chemical monitoring and control. The assignment has a maximum word length of 2500 words.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be required to prepare a scientific report based on the completion of a workplace occupational hygiene survey. The report is to be prepared in the style of a hygiene consultant's report with the aim of providing useful information for the purpose of completing a health risk assessment. The assignment has a maximum word length of 3000.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. Refer to Blackboard for the submission link. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
15 minutes in person practical assessment. The practical examination will require all students to demonstrate their understanding of the application of various instrumentation and equipment used for assessing occupational hygiene hazards. Each student will be assessed individually.

Students will complete their practical assessment in person. Please refer to Blackboard for your scheduled presentation time and location.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Theory exam scheduled centrally and held during the end of semester exam block. Short answer and short essay style questions. Assessing all content covered during the semester.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction to occupational hygiene

An introduction to occupational hygiene and its history, including an introduction to performing hazardous chemical risk assessments.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction to occupational hygiene An introduction to occupational hygiene and its history, including an introduction to performing hazardous chemical risk assessments.

learning_activities.topic:
Hazardous chemical qualitative risk assessments

A practical class to learn how to complete a qualitative hazardous chemical risk assessment, including the control banding approach.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Hazardous chemical qualitative risk assessments A practical class to learn how to complete a qualitative hazardous chemical risk assessment, including the control banding approach.

learning_activities.topic:
Workplace Exposure Limits (WELs) Theory

An overview of workplace exposure standards including a brief history, development of exposure standards, application, definitions, terminology, units, accessing exposure standards with examples, limitations, and potential problems (e.g. extended work schedule and workload considerations), etc.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Workplace Exposure Limits (WELs) Theory An overview of workplace exposure standards including a brief history, development of exposure standards, application, definitions, terminology, units, accessing exposure standards with examples, limitations, and potential problems (e.g. extended work schedule and workload considerations), etc.

learning_activities.topic:
Workplace Exposure LImits (WELs) Application

Exposure standards practical class.

Learning outcomes: L02, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Workplace Exposure LImits (WELs) Application Exposure standards practical class.

learning_activities.topic:
Occupational hygiene process

A detailed presentation of the occupational hygiene process, including an overview of monitoring strategies, such as personal, workplace and biological.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Occupational hygiene process A detailed presentation of the occupational hygiene process, including an overview of monitoring strategies, such as personal, workplace and biological.

learning_activities.topic:
Health Risk Assessment

Tutorial exploring current approaches to health risk assessment for hazardous chemicals, including modelling approaches.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Health Risk Assessment Tutorial exploring current approaches to health risk assessment for hazardous chemicals, including modelling approaches.

learning_activities.topic:
Control of hazardous chemical exposures 1

Introduction to the hierarchy of controls, including the underlying principles and practical application. Identifying effective control strategies, adopting the principles of reasonably practicable.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Control of hazardous chemical exposures 1 Introduction to the hierarchy of controls, including the underlying principles and practical application. Identifying effective control strategies, adopting the principles of reasonably practicable.

learning_activities.topic:
Control of hazardous chemical exposures 2

Practical exercises on the principles of control

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Control of hazardous chemical exposures 2 Practical exercises on the principles of control

learning_activities.topic:
Ventilation 1

The use of ventilation systems for the control of hazardous chemical exposures, including their design and assessment - lecture 1

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Ventilation 1 The use of ventilation systems for the control of hazardous chemical exposures, including their design and assessment - lecture 1

learning_activities.topic:
Ventilation 2

The use of ventilation systems for the control of hazardous chemical exposures, including their design and assessment - lecture 2

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Ventilation 2 The use of ventilation systems for the control of hazardous chemical exposures, including their design and assessment - lecture 2

learning_activities.topic:
Respiratory Protective Equipment Practical

Invited guest demonstrates the selection, fitting, care and use of respiratory protective equipment.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Respiratory Protective Equipment Practical Invited guest demonstrates the selection, fitting, care and use of respiratory protective equipment.

learning_activities.topic:
Ventilation Practical

Practical exercises to demonstrate the use of ventilation to control airborne contaminants and the monitoring of the effectiveness of ventilation systems.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Ventilation Practical Practical exercises to demonstrate the use of ventilation to control airborne contaminants and the monitoring of the effectiveness of ventilation systems.

learning_activities.topic:
Aerosols Lecture

Aerosols in the workplace: what are they? Development of workplace aerosol monitoring. Monitoring principles for aerosols.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Aerosols Lecture Aerosols in the workplace: what are they? Development of workplace aerosol monitoring. Monitoring principles for aerosols.

learning_activities.topic:
Aerosols Practical

Demonstration and practical class on aerosol sampling techniques.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Aerosols Practical Demonstration and practical class on aerosol sampling techniques.

learning_activities.topic:
Statistics Lecture and Tutorial

The lecture will provide an introduction to sampling statistics, including the use of statistics in the analysis and interpretation of hygiene monitoring data.

Learning outcomes: L01, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Statistics Lecture and Tutorial The lecture will provide an introduction to sampling statistics, including the use of statistics in the analysis and interpretation of hygiene monitoring data.

learning_activities.topic:
Report writing, communication and ethics

Hygiene report writing, communication, and ethics tutorial

Learning outcomes: L01, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Report writing, communication and ethics Hygiene report writing, communication, and ethics tutorial

learning_activities.topic:
Fibrous Dusts - Asbestos and SMF

Fibrous Dusts - Asbestos and SMF. What is asbestos, and what are the health effects? Sources and types of asbestos. Asbestos exposure in the workplace: past and present. Air sampling for asbestos. Synthetic mineral fibres, types and health effects.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Fibrous Dusts - Asbestos and SMF Fibrous Dusts - Asbestos and SMF. What is asbestos, and what are the health effects? Sources and types of asbestos. Asbestos exposure in the workplace: past and present. Air sampling for asbestos. Synthetic mineral fibres, types and health effects.

learning_activities.topic:
Asbestos and SMF Practical

Asbestos practical demonstration and exercises on asbestos sampling, fibre counting and identification, including calibration of pumps.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Asbestos and SMF Practical Asbestos practical demonstration and exercises on asbestos sampling, fibre counting and identification, including calibration of pumps.

learning_activities.topic:
Gases and Vapours Lecture

Types of gases and vapours, occupational health aspects of gases and vapours, monitoring of gases and vapours and commonly occurring gases and vapours.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Gases and Vapours Lecture Types of gases and vapours, occupational health aspects of gases and vapours, monitoring of gases and vapours and commonly occurring gases and vapours.

learning_activities.topic:
Metals Practical

Practical class on metals exposure monitoring.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Metals Practical Practical class on metals exposure monitoring.

learning_activities.topic:
Direct Reading Instruments for Gases and Vapours

Demonstration and practical exercises using reading instruments to monitor for gases and vapours.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Direct Reading Instruments for Gases and Vapours
learning_activities.topic_description: Direct Reading Instruments for Gases and Vapours Demonstration and practical exercises using reading instruments to monitor for gases and vapours.

learning_activities.topic:
Gas and vapour sampling practical

Demonstration and practical exercises using tubes and badges and direct-reading instruments to monitor for gases and vapours.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Gas and vapour sampling practical Demonstration and practical exercises using tubes and badges and direct-reading instruments to monitor for gases and vapours.

learning_activities.topic:
Dermal Exposure and Gloves

Lecture on dermal exposure and PPE selection and use for managing dermal exposure.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Dermal Exposure and Gloves Lecture on dermal exposure and PPE selection and use for managing dermal exposure.

learning_activities.topic:
Dermal Practical

Practical class on PPE, including gloves for dermal protection.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Dermal Practical Practical class on PPE, including gloves for dermal protection.

learning_activities.topic:
Case Studies

Case study tutorial and review for exam

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Case Studies Case study tutorial and review for exam

learning_activities.topic:
Review for Practical Exam

Practical class to prepare for the practical exam.

Learning outcomes: L04
